INTRODUCTION
Purpose of NAEB Region I Conference; The first NAEB Region I Conference was
held at the University of Massachusetts, April 8 and 9, 1955. Like previous NAEB
Regional meetings, this Conference was made possible by funds from the W. K. Kellogg
Foundation.
The purpose of this regional meeting was to give the NAEB members in Region I
an opportunity to discuss common problems, ask pertinent questions of Headquarters
representatives, get complaints off their chests, and engage in the sort of frank
discussion which larger conferences or open conventions do not permit.
In general, NAEB members have stated that this is the type of conference they
prefer, and the type they have gotten most out of at other regional meetings.
This meeting brought together NAEBers from Connecticut, Delaware, Maine, Mary¬
land, Massachusetts, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New York, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island,
Vermont in addition to Dr. Harry J. Skornia, NAEB Executive Director, and Mr. Cecil
Bidlack, NAEB TV Engineer, from the headquarters staff in Urbana, Illinois.
The Conference Committee extended to each delegate a hearty invitation to attend
this conference and earnestly hoped it would contribute to the personal development
in the educational Radio-TV field of every individual participating.
The joint committee which, in cooperation with the NAEB Headquarters staff,
planned the conference was composed of Dr. Harry M. Lyle, Massachusetts Board
of Educational Television! Professor Anthony W, Zaitz, WMUA, University of Massachu¬
setts! and Professor W. Worcester Smith, Western Massachusetts Educational Television
Council, Inc. These three also served as co-hosts for the conference.
